newsitem.title: UK: RUGBY UNION-LEICESTER SIGN SOUTH AFRICAN STRANSKY.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-LEICESTER SIGN SOUTH AFRICAN STRANSKY.

text.p: LEICESTER, England, Dec 12 (Retuer) - South African fly-half Joel Stransky became English rugby's latest big-name import on Thursday by joining Leicester.

Leicester's capture of Stransky, whose dramatic extra-time drop goal clinched the World Cup for his country 18 months ago, comes just nine days after the Springboks' World Cup skipper Francois Pienaar was snapped up by Saracens. Stransky has signed for 2-1/2 years.
Stransky made his international debut against Australia in 1993, averaging 12 points a test through to the World Cup final.
Leicester chief executive Peter Wheeler said: "We have got used to having world-class players at the club -- now we have another one."
